title: Brochures for Greek Travel- Greece for Visitors
text:
Thanks for sharing About.com with others! Most Emailed Articles 
How to Outsmart Dog Owners Who Don't Scoop Their Poop Death Valley Brochures for Greek Travel 
Every week the Greece for Visitors mailbox is filled with requests for printed information on Greece and Greek travel. This is something that's beyond my resources to provide, but, fortunately, there are great sources for all the Greece material any traveler could want - and best of all, it's free. And while I love the internet, there's nothing like a printed brochure left in a strategic place to stir up some Greek passion in a potential travel companion. Here are a few of my favorite sources for brochures on Greece: 
Best Free Booklets from the GNTO 
The Greek National Tourism Organization (GNTO) maintains offices in many countries. A phone call or email is all it takes to receive pamphlets and maps, though these days they prefer you download resources from the Greece brochure list on the GNTO website. 
Tip: If you do contact them directly, be as specific as possible. They have literally hundreds to choose from, so asking for "all the infomation you have" will result in a random selection. But if you say that you're visiting the Peloponnese, Delphi, and Mykonos, you'll generally receive more pertinent information tailored to your request. The Athens map is usually included, and it's a good, detailed one which goes beyond the basic tourist details.
